intro: Triosteon, commonly known as the mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are alternate and heart-shaped, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain numerous seeds. Triosteon is often found in mountainous areas and is adapted to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
